metadata.title: CVE-2017-16910 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
An error within the "LibRaw::xtrans_interpolate()" function(internal/dcraw_common.cpp) in LibRaw versions prior to 0.18.6 can beexploited to cause an invalid read memory access and subsequently a Denialof Service condition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16910` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.17.1-1ubuntu0.2
libraw15 - 0.17.1-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libraw package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.17.1-1ubuntu0.2').
ufraw: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
darktable: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
